titleInfo.title: Two page photomontage of Nashville's funeral homes. Nashville Banner, 1927 April 17.

mods.abstract: Two page photomontage of Nashville's funeral homes. Homes pictured include Crafton & Co. (610 Russell Street), M. S. Combs & Co. (Twenty-fifth Avenue North and Elliston Place), Sweeney Funeral Home (321 Woodland Street), Rains, Pettus, Burnette Company's Funeral Home (Elliston Place and Twenty-first Avenue), Wiles Brothers' Funeral Home (129 Eighth Avenue), Dorris Karsch & Company (Ninth Avenue and Commerce Street), Gupton Undertaking Company (215 Eighth Avenue South), Martin & Rollow's, Davis-Austin Company (1621 Broadway)and the National Funeral Home (209 Woodland Street). Of particular note are Wiles Brothers' and Rains Pettus, Burnette, both of which only employ white people/assistants and the National Funeral Home, which boasts Nashville's only lady undertaker. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.

originInfo.publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS 3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/digitallibraryoftennessee/DLTN_XSLT.
